In this SectionSDSUCollege of Arts and LettersAbout Arts and LettersAcademicsPeopleResearch and InnovationGive to Arts and LettersCollege of Arts and LettersEmpowering Students to Make a Difference in the World
A Place of Endless PossibilitiesThe College of Arts and Letters offers undergraduate and graduate degrees in the humanities and social sciences. Our programs explore the dynamics of human experiences, personal identities, cultural and cross-cultural expressions and practices, and philosophical beliefs regarding human life and existence. As a community of learners, students deepen their understanding of history and prehistory, literature, languages, religions, gender, ethnicity, class and race, and social and political actions.85+Majors & Minors25Graduate Programs30+Certificate ProgramsExplore Our Programs
See Us in ActionSDSU Awarded $10M for Center to Foster Environmental JusticeHisham Foad Named Fred J. Hansen Chair of Peace StudiesTruman Scholar Looks to a Better World for Refugee, Migrant GirlsRead more news
Give to Arts and LettersUndergraduate ResearchLearn more about undergraduate researchMessage from the Interim DeanYour liberal arts education in humanities and the social sciences is valued and centered. Learning from our passionate faculty experts gives you the opportunity to consider some of the most profound questions facing humanity and to discover a deeper understanding of yourself and your place in the world.Ronnee SchreiberInterim Dean, College of Arts and LettersRead more
